title: 'Predatory' Uber driver continued sex assault on passenger while she vomited
text:

A "predatory" Uber driver who continued his sex attack on a passenger while she was being sick is facing jail.

Temur Shah, 45, insisted the woman sat next to him on the front passenger seat when he picked her up in London's West End in the early hours of January 15, 2018.

The 27-year-old victim told Shah she was going to be sick and when she leaned out of the door, he groped her intimately.

He continued to sexually assault her as she vomited onto the pavement in an attack that has been described as "disgusting".

Shah's victim had no money or charge on her phone battery and the pervert refused to let her go, Isleworth Crown Court heard.

(Image: PA)

She told him not to touch her again and she finally escaped his clutches near her home in north London before contacting police.

The Taxi and Private Hire Policing Team then conducted enquiries with Uber and the person who booked the private hire vehicle on the victim's behalf.

They also collected an extensive amount of CCTV and viewed GPS data from Uber.

Shah, of Harrow, northwest London, was convicted of sexual assault after a one-week trial.

Mandy McGregor, Head of Transport Policing and Community Safety at TfL, said: "This attack on a vulnerable passenger was predatory and disgusting, and we are pleased to see that Shah has been convicted.

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

"I would like to thank the young woman for coming forward and reporting this so TfL and the police could investigate and take action against the driver.

"We expect the highest standards from TfL licensed taxi and private hire drivers.

"Not only has Shah been convicted but immediate licensing action was taken to prevent him from continuing in his role as a TfL licensed private hire driver.

Detective Superintendent Andy Cox, from the Roads and Transport Policing Command, said: "Shah despicably took advantage of his position as a trusted licensed driver and sexually assaulted a passenger in a vulnerable state.

"His conviction was down to a meticulous investigation which left the jury in no doubt as to his guilt."

Shah was bailed ahead of sentence at the same court on 12 November.
description: Temur Shah, 45, groped a passenger after he picked her up in his Uber from London's West End
